thread.title: Officials Identify Pedestrian Struck, Killed By Cab Downtown
thread.title_full: Officials Identify Pedestrian Struck, Killed By Cab Downtown

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Officials Identify Pedestrian Struck, Killed By Cab Downtown
text:
Officials Identify Pedestrian Struck, Killed By Cab Downtown March 18, 2017 6:22 PM Filed Under: Allegheny County Medical Examiner's Office , Jaafar Bey , Vets Taxi (Photo Credit: Ralph Iannotti/KDKA) 
PITTSBURGH (KDKA) — One man was killed and another injured after they were struck by a taxi cab on Friday night in Downtown Pittsburgh. 
The Allegheny County Medical Examiner’s Office has identified the man killed as Jaafar Bey, 55, of Carnegie. 
Bey and another man were struck by a Vets Taxi cab that jumped the curb along Liberty Avenue near the intersection of Sixth Street.
